content.body:
How feasible would it be to embed binary strings inside JS?
Something like `const binary = 17’...binary data...’`, denoting 17 bytes of non-utf binary data.

content.body: I think the spec could be easy enough, but the challenge is making sure browsers don’t run a UTF8 step before letting JS parse.
I don't think engines would go for that, no
or other tools, for that matter
just do `Uint8Array.fromBase64(/*data*/)`; after gzip this should be basically the same size anyway
content.formatted_body: just do Uint8Array.fromBase64(/*data*/); after gzip this should be basically the same size anyway

content.body: I’m trying to avoid Base64’s byte increase and the time needed to decode it (10ms+ for each of several stings)
I would expect Uint8Array.fromBase64 to be a great deal faster than that.
